title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 123.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 123.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in this Part, "Indigenous name, logo, or mascot"
means a name, symbol, or image that depicts or refers to Indigenous persons, tribes, nations, individuals, customs, symbols, or traditions, including actual
or stereotypical aspects of Indigenous cultures, used to represent a public
school, including but not limited to such schools sports teams. It does not
include a public school, school building, or school district named after an

Indigenous tribe. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
123.1

Adopted

New

York State Register May 3, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 18, eff. 5/3/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
